Subject: Modeling counterflow flames containing water drops in oxider stream
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=183616209
X-Yahoo-Profile: rcm6189

I'm working on a project looking at the effects of adding water drops
to the oxider stream of a non-premixed counterflow burner to study
flame extinction. We need to do computational modeling to complement
the experimental effort. The Python scripts distributed with Cantera
provide a good description of the gas flow and flame front. The
ability to include the interaction of water drops with the flow field
does not appear to be present. How difficult would it be to add this
ability to Cantera and what would be the best approach to do so?
Unfortunately, my programming experience is primarily in Fortran.

Thanks for any advice that you can provide.

Rick

==========================================
Dr. Richard C. Mowrey
